text: “I often have trouble making sense of an experience until I’ve laboriously written it down, or turned it into fiction.” An interview with Paul Theroux. https://t.co/TjgDBAnobR

text: In an except drawn from “The Dead Are Arising: The Life of Malcolm X,” Les Payne details the assassination of Malcolm X and the government’s botched investigation of his murder. https://t.co/rgKEe1QkT0

text: Our TV critics offer 40 recommendations for home viewing, from the “The Brady Bunch” to “Schitt’s Creek.” https://t.co/1nvlFc0T4d

text: Mandy Patinkin discusses his four-decade career, the importance of walking towards fear, and becoming a quarantine social-media star. https://t.co/tzFNeCapov

name: NewYorker
text: “Every Belarusian is overcoming their fears right now,” the leader of democratic Belarus said. “Two months ago, I couldn’t bring myself to say words like ‘dictator’ or ‘usurper’ about Lukashenka. The more he cracks down, the easier it gets.” https://t.co/fmJVeFQJvn

name: NewYorker
text: “Right from the beginning, I’ve always gone to stories when I feel that I can tell them in a special way, that they’re mine, that they won’t let me go.” An interview with the filmmaker @MiraPagliNair. https://t.co/qcfyrtrx6g

text:

text: A scene from Oliver Hirschbiegel’s 2004 film “Downfall,” of Hitler’s final days, has spawned a thousand YouTube parodies. But it is based, in part, on problematic sources. https://t.co/Gvk8VHjARe

name: NewYorker
text: Nearly every aspect of our pandemic response has become politicized, @DhruvKhullar writes. Our greatest challenge is not the virus but ourselves. https://t.co/u6k9Jss1J1

text:

name: NewYorker
text: David Fincher’s new film, “Mank,” is an attempt to define the nature of Herman Mankiewicz’s contribution to “Citizen Kane,” and to the history of cinema—and to dramatize his battle to get credit for it. https://t.co/qa7BNOf4Eo

text: Crowns have been worn by rulers and divinities of both sexes since prehistoric times. https://t.co/pRhuO2C9Ls

name: NewYorker
text:

name: NewYorker
text: Actors always allow us to imagine lives beyond our own; this year, they were our avatars, roaming free while we sat and watched and waited. https://t.co/CkJV5t8uUv
